qas.question: In which book of the Bible did God reference gifts of Blue Purple and Scarlet?
What does coccumque bis tinctum translate to in english?
In ancient greek, what is coccus referred to as?
What does Kokkos mean in english?
In what century did the latin vulgate bible use the term coccumque bis tinctum?
Who did Moses instruct to bring him cloth?
What color cloth did Moses have the Israelites bring him?
What does tinctum bis coccumque translate to?
What Greek word does Kokkos derive from?

context: Kermes is also mentioned in the Bible. In <a0_0>the Book of Exodus<a0_0/>, <b5_0>God<b5_0/> instructs Moses to have the Israelites bring him an offering including cloth "of <b6_0>blue, and purple, and scarlet.<b6_0/>" The term used for scarlet in the <a4_0>4th century<a4_0/> Latin Vulgate version of the Bible passage is coccumque bis tinctum, meaning "<a1_0><b7_0>colored twice with coccus<b7_0/><a1_0/>." <b8_0>Coccus,<b8_0/> from the ancient Greek <a2_0>Kokkos<a2_0/>, means <a3_0>a tiny grain<a3_0/> and is the term that was used in ancient times for the Kermes vermilio insect used to make the Kermes dye. This was also the origin of the expression "dyed in the grain."
